title: God’s Covenant and Moses’ Commission
shortSummary: Exodus chapter 6 reveals God's reaffirmation of His covenant with Israel and His promise to deliver them from Egyptian bondage. God identifies Himself as Jehovah, promising liberation and inheritance of the promised land, while Moses and Aaron are commissioned to confront Pharaoh. The chapter also provides genealogical details of the tribe of Levi, emphasizing the leadership lineage.

keyCharacters.name: Moses
keyCharacters.description: God’s chosen leader to deliver Israel from Egypt, who expresses concern over his speaking ability and the people's disbelief.

keyCharacters.name: Aaron
keyCharacters.description: Moses’ brother and spokesman, co-leader in the mission to bring Israel out of Egypt.

keyCharacters.name: Pharaoh
keyCharacters.description: The king of Egypt who holds the Israelites in bondage and will be confronted by Moses and Aaron.

keyCharacters.name: Levi
keyCharacters.description: The patriarch of the Levite tribe, whose descendants include Moses and Aaron, detailed in the genealogical record.

definitions.definition: The personal, covenant name of God revealed to Moses, emphasizing His eternal and self-existent nature.
A solemn agreement between God and His people, involving promises and obligations, foundational to Israel’s identity.
A metaphor used by Moses indicating his perceived inadequacy or lack of eloquence in speaking before Pharaoh.
The land promised by God to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, signifying the inheritance of the Israelites.

outline.heading: God’s Promise of Deliverance
outline.description: God reassures Moses that He will act with power to free Israel from Egypt, revealing His covenant name Jehovah and promising to bring them into the promised land.

outline.heading: Israel’s Response and God’s Command
outline.description: Despite Moses’ message, the Israelites do not listen due to their suffering; God commands Moses to speak to Pharaoh to release the people.

outline.heading: Genealogy of Levi
outline.description: A detailed listing of the descendants of Levi, highlighting the lineage of Moses and Aaron, establishing their authority and priestly heritage.

outline.heading: Moses’ Concern and God’s Assurance
outline.description: Moses expresses doubt about his speaking ability, but God reaffirms His presence and instructions to confront Pharaoh.

application: Trust in God’s promises even when circumstances seem hopeless, remembering He is faithful to His covenant.
Obediently follow God’s calling despite personal doubts or perceived inadequacies, relying on His strength.
Encourage others with God’s word, understanding that spiritual breakthrough may require perseverance amid discouragement.
Recognize the importance of God’s appointed leaders and respect the divine order He establishes for His people.

keyVerses.text: Wherefore say unto the children of Israel, I am the LORD, and I will bring you out from under the burdens of the Egyptians, and I will rid you out of their bondage, and I will redeem you with a stretched out arm, and with great judgments:
keyVerses.significance: This verse powerfully declares God's promise of redemption and deliverance, highlighting His sovereign power and faithfulness.

keyVerses.text: And I appeared unto Abraham, unto Isaac, and unto Jacob, by the name of God Almighty, but by my name JEHOVAH was I not known to them.
keyVerses.significance: God reveals His covenant name Jehovah, emphasizing a deeper, personal relationship with His people in this new phase of redemption.

keyVerses.text: And Moses said before the LORD, Behold, I am of uncircumcised lips, and how shall Pharaoh hearken unto me?
keyVerses.significance: Moses’ honest admission of his limitations teaches reliance on God’s power rather than human ability.
